intro: Clibadium sprucei, commonly known as the yellow-leaf senna, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features compound leaves with a distinctive yellow hue, and its flowers are typically yellow or orange in color. Clibadium sprucei produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in open woodlands and along stream banks.
